container_image.name: Container Image
container_image.help:
Specify the container image to run and launch the server.
On Jetson, pick a tag that is compatible with your version of JetPack.
For example, L4T r36.4.0 images are compatible with JetPack 6.1 and 6.2.
These are built from jetson-containers with CUDA and are on DockerHub.

container_options.name: Docker Options
container_options.help: These are extra prefix flags that get passed to 'docker run' when starting the container.  These are the arguments that come before the container image name, for example --volume ~/workspace:/workspace --env WORKSPACE=/workspace

container_cmd.name: Docker Run Cmd
container_cmd.help:
Template that builds the 'docker run' command from $OPTIONS $IMAGE $ARGS
You can change the startup command or arguments with this.

server_host.name: Server IP / Port
server_host.help:
The server's hostname/IP and port that it is listening on for incoming requests.
0.0.0.0 will listen on all network interfaces (127.0.0.1 from localhost only)
This IP address also gets populated in the examples, so set it to your device.
